column4: Hello! Please I need help: here is the description: http://paste.ubuntu.com/437774/ thanks :)
Please give at least an overview of your problem *here* (all in one line) - you will get a much greater audience.
you can add a virtualbox ppa and then install normally with synaptics
how to do that?
see "Debian-based Linux distributions" on http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Linux_Downloads

: ok I got that.. I went there in the first place and I download the .deb package as normal, installed it normally and then what? I was not able to lanuch virtualbox! and when I type virtualbox in the terminal it was reporting that it is not installed and when I install it from the normal command of the terminal it is getting the 3.08 version which is the version supported by Ubuntu 9.10
I was talking about adding the repo, then you don't need to download any debs for virtual box any more
please pastebin the content of /etc/apt/sources.list.d/dnjl-virtualization-repository.list
: Sure sir! Thanks just a moment
but you will have to install 3.2 first
: Roger that Captain!
^^ was meant as answer for your previous statement
: Yeah I will clean everything and I will install the .deb package... I will paste the list of repository list also
you shouldn't need the deb package
: Oh ok! I will paste the list then
: http://paste.ubuntu.com/437779/
: here is the list, I hope that what you were asking for
comparing ... it looks as if you are still using the old key for the virtualbox repo, they have a new one since 3.2 (oracle!)
: oh thanks I didn't know that :)
: I should get the new one from the website right?
yes, after adding the new key you will have to refresh your software database, and then isntalling 3.2 should run smoothly
: Thanks sir for that! :) I will try that and I will inform you back! Thanks also for your time up there.
you're welcome :-)
